meanings.definition: A smaller sample taken from a larger sample.
meanings.sent1: I only had a small subsample of the candies in the jar.
meanings.sent2: The scientist analyzed the subsample of water to understand its quality.
meanings.sent3: The tiny subsample of cookies left in the jar made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stamps was just a subsample of what her grandfather had.
meanings.sent5: The subsample of stars visible through the telescope was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To select a smaller portion of a larger sample for analysis.
meanings.sent1: She needed to subsample the data to make it more manageable.
meanings.sent2: The researcher decided to subsample the soil to study its composition.
meanings.sent3: He tried to subsample the ice cream but ended up with a giant scoop.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to subsample the colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent5: In order to save time, they had to subsample the survey responses.
